column4: Whats the easiest way to upgrade a package to the newest version rather than reinstalling it?
if a package says it needs two others... why wont apt-get build-dep work?
just apt-get install <packageName>  will fix dependencies
seemingly not. http://paste.ziber.org/57071
you have broken packages?
without the package name it gives http://paste.ziber.org/57072 and with it:
http://paste.ziber.org/57073
Are version of Ubuntu are you using?  It seems to think you're using unstable or something?
oh yeah?
This is a new VPS that I recently bought. Out of habit, I tend to copy /etc/apt/sources.list from other servers I have. I think I copied a 9.04 sources.list to 9.10.
possible
yay!
There are so few sources in the default sources.list tho
haha, try slackware!
any place i can get a file with more sources, tho?
Well you should probably pick each one up individually so that you don't get one in the mix that is malicious
true, that'd be smarter.
jsut so used to having a myriad of sources. iirc, the ubuntu 9.10 one has... 2? 3?
But those 2 or 3 have 20,000 + packages
yeah... guess the number of sources dont matter.
thanks for your help
you figured it out
